text: let's talk about the wheel versus my favorite the coverage strangle i wanted to show you an example of why i tend to prefer the coverage strangle not saying that the wheel's bad but for the way that i trade the covered strangle tends to be a little more optimal now first let's start with level setting what's the difference between the two it's really my new the primary difference between the wheel and the coverage strangle is when we're selling additional short puts so they both start with a cash secured put you can manage this cash secure put however you like to manage puts so for me i have different profit and loss taking metrics normally around 60 credit received or um if i'm within a certain time frame i might look to manage the trade kind of like i have outline in my main video on the coverage strangle now let's say we continue to deploy the cash secured put until we're assigned at that point we would look to sell a covered call that's the same in both strategies however this is where the difference emerges once we sell that covered call in the wheel we stay there we continue to sell short calls against our long stock position that we were assigned on until it goes away in the covered strangle while that covered call is working we would sell additional cash secured puts and this is the primary reason why i like the coverage

text: stay there we continue to sell short calls against our long stock position that we were assigned on until it goes away in the covered strangle while that covered call is working we would sell additional cash secured puts and this is the primary reason why i like the coverage strangle because it allows us to remain a little more sensitive to price it also allows us to be more active and get more trades on to realize more profits so let's take a look at an example what i did was i went into think back this is december 2nd of 2015 right here so that's what this chart is and then this is where i just neutralized the position it definitely would have gone on longer i just made an assumption in terms of the short calls being assigned and coming off so that we could just kind of talk about it now what i want to walk through is why i chose this time frame one it was random i literally picked a random time frame because i think that's helpful but i did look for something that i knew that there was a drop included because that's really where the risk lies in this strategy so if i had just picked a scenario where you know the price was just going up we would just be essentially selling the same short putts so i wanted to walk through when we're actually managing the trade taking stock

text: 9th so again somewhere right in here and now we're finally starting to get kind of improved on our underlying to our basis the underlying at this point is trading for like 109 and change so let's pause this and take a look let's say we go out 60 days and let's take a look at our 116s at our basis we could sell a call against our position for 51 cents something like that in my opinion if i was deploying the strategy i would not offer calls here yet they are still very far out of the money if i was trading the wheel i might send these calls out because i'm not making any money at this point in the wheel i'm just holding on to long stock not the end of the world but i'm not making a bunch of money whereas on the on the covered strangle i'm still generating returns via the cash secured put side of things so i would be even less inclined to add short calls out because you're getting pennies on the dollar essentially this is at our basis there is an opportunity cost to be holding the stock for this period of time even so far so in order to make any money here we would essentially have to sell right at our basis so what that means is on the wheel you would make a hundred dollars and you would make no money on the stock to me

text: we would have been slightly out of the money essentially all that would have happened is we would have collected money on both of these short calls realized that profit offered new short calls at a higher point as well as offered additional short puts but again i didn't want to go too crazy with the example here it's already a 20 minute long video but i wanted to show you a really important aspect which is by trading the covered strangle we can be a lot more active in realizing profits and we offer the ability for us to reduce our overall basis once we're assigned on subsequent short puts now the one potential upside for something like the wheel is let's say we're trading around where we are right now in the example and it's 114. you could choose to only sell one short call at your basis so you could say i'm going to sell one short call at 116 i'm going to leave a hundred shares open and then you have the ability to appreciate more on the upside than you would on the covered strangle example so there are ways to optimize both of them but again just based on my experience trading both of these strategies the reasons why i explained to you are explicitly why i gravitate to the coverage strangle because bear markets or when we crash tend to last for a pretty long period of time it's something like 290 something
